tags.bio: Carol Rumens is the author of 14 collections of poems, as well as occasional fiction, drama and translation. She has received the Cholmondeley Award and the Prudence Farmer Prize, and was joint recipient of an Alice Hunt Bartlett Award. Her most recent publication is the prose book, Self into Song, based on three poetry lectures delivered in the Bloodaxe-Newcastle University Lecture Series. She is currently professor in creative writing at Bangor University, and is a fellow of the Royal Society of Literature. Her latest collection is De Chirico's Threads, published by Seren Books.

humanitarian trips in Africa, three UK general elections and a World

webTitle: Oxford and Cambridge applications mapped - explore the north/south divide

fields.standfirst:
The top ten districts accounted for more than one in every four places offered last year, despite making up only 17% of the eligible population. Students from Surrey alone accounted for 263 of the 5,924 offers - almost twice as many as the whole of Wales. Application rates themselves also varied wildly - five districts in Wales and the North East saw fewer than ten students apply last year, with only two from Blaenau Gwent. webTitle: Guardian Camera Club: Robert Norbury's portfolio

fields.standfirst:
A review of Robert Norbury's portfolio.

These impressionistic images, grouped together in sets of three to nine, have been made in the Saatchi Gallery. Although the idea of observing this audience is potentially interesting, it's only 'Man Tying his Laces Saatchi Gallery' that utilises the triptych format to good effect, and here the similarity of the panels becomes a strength. 'Dancing Girl' is simply too confused, and lacks the necessary visual simplicity to be effective. 'Woman in Doorway' would do to lose the right hand frame, that way the mystery would somehow be maintained. 'Three People Moving' is simply ordinary; 'Two Girls' has two (in focus) frames, that are both redundant. 'Single Man' is an effective triptych, and combined with 'Man Tying his Laces' is the essence of the concept, which unfortunately doesn't stretch to six images
fields.headline: Guardian Camera Club: Robert Norbury's portfolio
fields.trailText: A review of Robert Norbury's portfolio
